page.title: 05Dairy - Express Dairy
page.content: Milk is collected from nearby farms by milk tankers, the average milk intake is per day is 100,000 gallons. Milk is pumped from the milk tankers into 30,000 gallon milk storage silos. From the silos it is pasteurised which kills the germs. It is separated into cream and skim milk. The cream is then homogenised which breaks up the fat globules into either 48% or 18% cream. The cream is then packed into cartons. The skimmed milk can be either dried or mixed with sugar & fruit to make yogurt. Cottage cheese is also made at the factory along with soft cheese. There are many laboratories testing the incoming milk also the products are tested for bacteria. The waste water goes to an effluent plant which treats it before it is returned to the river. Sarah Nowell.
